column5: http://www.heartland.on.ca/

Definately go to Meline's Lodge and Guide Service in Nestor Falls, beautiful lodge and cabins for a really good price. The owners do the guiding as well, no worries about getting a good guide. I'm pretty sure their website is www.canadafishingtrips.com
witchbay.com Make sure to investigate the FISHING PROGRAM page on the site. Have fun wherever you go. Lunk

maybe the Pickle lake area. never really been that way. Price is a concern for us since it is our 2nd trip of the year. we do our own cooking and cleaning. we need a houskeeping plan. thanks for the info so far though.
I have openings for late August/early September. Send me a note at [email protected] and I can give you some details.

Sorry, but we have no website at the moment, but we are located five minutes away from Mahkwa Lodge, if you ever heard of that camp as well, and as a previous guide for Mahkwa, vaughn lake has excellent fishin, not just in June, I've lived in the heartland of Lac Seul all my life. We don't have a camping site, we offer housekeeping plan with all the amenities or comforts of home. Thanks Brian and Jack 807 582 3903 of 807 582 9622.
Do you have camping and what are your rates? Any websites?

My website is www.agatebaylodge.com check it out, and let me know if you have any questions. I could accommodate for camping, I do not have sewer facilities, so you would have to be self contained. Have boats/motors on multiple lakes. Drop me a line to talk pricing. The only way to reach me is via email this time of year. There are no phones in camp.

Check out www.goldpines.com to see if they have an opening in early September. There may still be a waiting list, so be prepared. The camp owners are wonderful people who will bend over backward to satisfy. Last year their first opening was late August.
You should check out Minaki, Great fishing beautiful lakes and river system. A low priced resort with housekeeping cabins and RV sites is www.paradisecoveminaki.com

looking at a last minute trip to ontario in early sept or late august. there are only three of us and we want to drive in. looking for a somewhat cheap, quick trip. We ARE walleye fishing. any thoughts or ideas from the masses would be great!!
Click on Search and type in Looking for a drive in Topic 36830 in September 2004 had a lot of posts. One of the resort mentioned may be of interest to you.
What part of Ontario are you planning to visit?
really does not matter. we usually head up thorugh intrenational falls and go to dryden. usually up in that area i guess. can go east or west or north of dryden?
Check out Vermilion Bay Lody on Eagle Lake.www.vermilionbaylodge.com
Try Deer Path Lodge at Hudson Ontario. Rick is a great guy to help people.
north star lodge on clay lake.. fihed there the last 2 augusts.. real good smallies pike and walleye. easy to navigate real good hosts.. 20 mins north of vermilion bay on 105. cant go wrong here.

Hello, we are a new camp, have some openings for august left also september, we are at the entrance to vaughn lake on the north side,so far our guests have enjoyed our camp and rebooked for next year so give us a call anytime jack 807-582-3903 or brian 807-582-9622. Thank - you!
Do you have a website, and do you allow camping? Which part of the lake are you located? (excuse me for not doing a thorough search first... :) )

wooglin, vaughn lake on lac seul is over an hour north east of the hudson landing. we almost went to vaughn lake one day when we were up a couple of weeks ago in june as a camp owner on minnitaki who also guides alot on lac seul told us that the 1st week or two that the sanctuaries open up vaughn is the best spot on lac seul (it is a sanctuary and does not open until june 16 each year) he told us shear numbers and size are unbeatable until the late june then don't bother. scar
